{"step_by_step_thinking": "The active principle of a plant refers to the main compound or group of compounds responsible for the plant's effects. In the case of white oleander, the documents mention that oleanders contain cardenolides, which are capable of exerting positive inotropic effects on the hearts of animals and humans. The major toxic components are the cardiac glycosides oleandrin and neriin. Therefore, the active principle of white oleander is likely to be one of these compounds.", "answer_choice": "B. Nerin"}
